We examine the impact of a linear transformation \\( f(z) = Mz \\), where \\( M \\) is a complex constant matrix.

If, at a certain time \\( t_1 \\), a new function \\( g(z) = Nz \\) (where \\( N \\) is another complex constant matrix) is applied as an intervention, will the endpoint \\( z(T) \\) for T > t_1 depend only on \\( \\omega \\) and not on \\( k \\), \\( M \\), or \\( N \\)?
Explanation: The endpoint \\( z(T) \\) will be influenced by all mentioned variables (\\( \\omega \\), \\( k \\), \\( M \\), and \\( N \\)). The new intervention with \\( g(z) \\) at \\( t_1 \\) alters the trajectory in a compound manner with the existing dynamics and the preceding transformation \\( M \\).
